mdRecord.dcterms:title: York River Virginia, from entrance to King's Creek / from a trigonometrical survey under the direction of A. D. Bache Superintendent of the Survey of the Coast of the United States ; triangulation by E. Blunt, J. Farley & Lieut. J. P. Roy U.S.A. Assts. ; topography by John Seib Assistant ; hydrography by the parties under the command of Lieuts. J. J. Almy & R. D. Minor U.S.N. Assists
York River, lower
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Almy, John Jay, 1815-1895
Bache, A. D. (Alexander Dallas), 1806-1867

mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 41 x 56 cm. on sheet 55 x 71 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relief shown by depth soundings and shading.
Oriented with north towards upper left.
"Issued August 1877 C. P. Patterson Superintendent. Verified, J. E. Hilgard Assistant in charge of Office. (Date of first publication 1857.)"
Notes on tides, courses and bearins, distances, soundings.
Redd. drng. by A. Lindenkohl & P. Witzel.
Engd. by A. Maedel & W. Langran.
Printed left to right in upper margin: No. 398. Price 20 cents. Plate No. 987. Electrotype copy no. 4 by G. Mathiot U.S.C.S.
Printed in lower right margin: (York River, Lower). U.S.C. & G.S. 398."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Nautical charts--Virginia--York River.
